critique: The document pertains to an amendment to Regulation No. 3, issued under the Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935. It modifies the requirements for contractors on housing projects financed by the Act, specifically reducing the percentage of work that the superstructure contractor must perform directly without subcontracting from 25% to 15%. This suggests a slight shift towards deregulation or flexibility in contracting, but primarily focuses on the economic regulation aspect. There's no explicit mention of social issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, security, or liberty.
